item.title: Germanyâ€™s Merz fails to be elected chancellor in shock first-round parliamentary vote
item.description: Friedrich Merz failed to get the majority needed to become German chancellor in a parliamentary vote Tuesday.

item.title: Credit Suisse to pay $511 million for helping U.S. taxpayers hide over $4 billion overseas
item.description: "Credit Suisse AG committed new crimes and breached its May 2014 plea agreement," the DOJ said in announcing the penalty with the UBS subsidiary.

item.title: Federal judge says results of North Carolina court race with Democrat ahead must be certified
item.description: More than 5.5 million ballots were cast in what has been the country's last undecided race from the general election in November.

item.title: U.S. commodities regulator seeks to drop appeal of Kalshi election bets offers
item.description: Kalsi in January named Donald Trump Jr., the eldest son of President Trump, as a strategic advisor.

item.title: Trump, Jon Voight meeting led to Hollywood tariff proposal, his manager says
item.description: A White House spokesman said "no final decision on foreign film tariffs have been made," a day after President Trump's announcement of a tariff plan.
